gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This is a sample AIXM 5.1 dataset for Canada, created to showcase how NLP techniques can extract and analyze meaningful aviation insights.

aixm:LinguisticNote.aixm:note: This ILS approach procedure includes a steep descent profile due to terrain constraints.
Monitor wind shear conditions closely during final approach.
This SID procedure requires climbing at a minimum rate of 800 fpm.
Traffic separation is in effect for departing aircraft.

aixm:FlightRestrictionTimeSlice.aixm:restrictionDetails: Runway operations at selected airports are restricted to daytime only during winter months.
All aircraft must maintain a minimum separation of 3000 ft above ground level within controlled airspace.
Operations are limited to IFR conditions during severe weather alerts.

aixm:NOTAMTimeSlice.aixm:note: NOTAM: Temporary closure of Runway 09L/27R for scheduled maintenance.
NOTAM: Restricted airspace due to VIP movement in the Ottawa region.
NOTAM: Temporary change in approach procedures at Toronto Pearson International due to construction work.

aixm:RulesProceduresTimeSlice.aixm:procedureDetails: All departures from Montreal-Trudeau International must follow SID MT001 during peak hours.
Approaches to Vancouver International must follow STAR VI001 with a minimum descent rate of 700 ft/min.

aixm:LinguisticNote.aixm:note: Mandatory equipment inspection required for all aircraft during winter operations.
Emergency procedures must be reviewed bi-annually by all operational staff.
